<strong>[Hi, I am Florian ! ]{style="font-size: xx-large;"}</strong><br>

I am a Project Leader at the Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences ([RBINS](https://www.naturalsciences.be/)) in Brussels. My projects involve the development of biogeochemical models and data visualization tools for the Belgian offshore wind farm.

I am particularly interested in developping data visualization and exploitation tools for scientists and policy makers.

## Education

2019-23 \| **PhD in Biogeochemistry**, *Towards a new insight of the carbon transport in the global ocean* ([Enjoy it here](https://orbi.uliege.be/handle/2268/304539)), Villefranche Oceanographic Laboratory, Sorbonne University, France

2016-18 \| **Master of Science in Oceanography**, University of Liège, Belgium

2013-16 \| **Bachelor in Applied Sciences**, University of Liège, Belgium

## Experience

Current \| **Project Leader**, Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences, Belgium

2018-19 \| **Researcher**, University of Liège, Belgium

<h2>Data Scientist | Machine Learning Enthusiast | Avid Cyclist</h2>
<p>With a PhD in biogeochemistry, I've found my true calling at the intersection of data science and marine research. My expertise lies not just in understanding the ocean, but in harnessing the power of data to unlock its secrets.</p>
<h3>Professional Highlights</h3>
<ul>
  <li>Developed an automatic zooplankton classification model using machine learning for autonomous underwater vehicles</li>
  <li>Created <a href="https://github.com/ecotaxa/uvpec/">uvpec</a>, a Python package for training image classification models for the <a href="http://www.hydroptic.com/index.php/public/Page/product_item/UVP6-LP">Underwater Vision Profiler 6</a></li>
  <li>Expertise in Big Data analysis and visualization in oceanography</li>
</ul>
<h3>Projects</h3>

  <li><a href="https://fricour-ws.observablehq.cloud/particle-explorer/">ParticleExplorer</a></li>
